body.name: Delta Children Serta Perfect Extra Wide Convertible Sofa to Lounger, Comfy 2-in-1 Flip Open Couch/Sleeper for Kids, Grey
deliveryMessages: Or fastest delivery Wednesday, February 14. Order within 20 hrs 46 mins
features: CONVERTIBLE 2-IN-1 DESIGN: This flip-open sofa converts to a lounger/sleeper| Ideal for reading, relaxing, playing or sleeping, your child will enjoy this couch with siblings/friends | Recommended for ages 18 months+ | Comfortably fits 3 small children and 2 older children

COMFY FOAM CONSTRUCTION: Supportive Serta foam construction keeps its shape and provides all-day comfort | Non-slip bottom prevents chair from moving around | Super-soft slipcover features embossed sheep pattern | Side pocket keeps books within reach
EASY TO CLEAN: Chair comes with a removable machine-washable slipcover that zips off for easy cleaning
LIGHTWEIGHT + PORTABLE: Lightweight chair can be moved from room to room | Great for bedrooms, playrooms, basements, gaming or studying
EASY TO UNBOX: Chair ships in super-small box | Once unboxed chair expands 5x (may take 24 hours to fully expand) | Sofa size: 30”W x 17”D x 15”H | Lounger size when flipped open: 30"W x 40"D x 12"H
body.description: The Serta Perfect Sleeper Extra Wide Convertible Sofa to Lounger is a cozy chair by day, laid-back lounger by night. This convertible seat easily flips open to reveal multiple ways for your child to relax--they’ll love to sit and read or watch their favorite movies on the chair but when it’s time for a nap, this seat folds out into a comfy sleeper bed. Big enough to fit three small kids comfortably in sofa mode, it’s light enough to move around the house and is ideal for your children to share during playtime or sleepovers. The super-soft slipcover embossed with an adorable Serta sheep pattern features an easy-to-reach side pocket where your little one can keep their favorite books or tablet. The supportive foam construction will keep its shape and provides all-day comfort. Plus, the chair's non-slip bottom ensures it stays in place. Designed to ship in a super-small box, this lightweight foam kids’ sofa and lounger may take up to 24 hours to fully expand once unboxed. Machine-washable slipcover zips off for easy cleaning. Recommended for ages 18 months+. Available in Grey and Pink.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 1, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Tips/Tricks to make this the product you want!
reviews.reviewText: I love Amazon, but I over research and overthink everything! The reviews seemed mixed on this one, but let me tell you- it’s better than you’re reading. I bought 2 of these. They do come in tiny little boxes. The fabric piece is wrapped separately and I had no issues with ripping/separating of the fabric- I checked before I even started. The foam comes all rolled in plastic and vacuumed packed. Once unrolled, I thought for sure it was gonna be a disaster. The instructions said it would take 24h for the foam to fully reinflate, but didn’t say whether to put it together before or after the time passed. So I decided maybe it’d be easier to do it before. It was awful- struggled to get the foam in place, and it looked so flimsy/flat when I finished. So I undid all my hard work and let the foam sit. Later in the day, the pieces didn’t really look like they were perking up much (granted it hadn’t been 24h yet). So I decided to try warming them with my hairdryer to see if the heat would expand the foam. Lemme tell ya, it was like magic and they filled in before my eyes. I then let them all sit until the next day for them to still expand on their own some more. When I went to assemble, it was SO MUCH EASIER once they were ready- almost like the piece just fit in the puzzle because it was exactly the size it needed to be instead of struggling with extra fabric on too small foam. They only part that was tricky for me was with the slanted pieces with the blue dots that need to line up. The instructions would say “facing-down” and then say “facing-up” and I got all sorts of confused. Basically, which ever way you’re putting your pieces in, make sure that the blue dots that have the foam touching are gonna be on the upside when you have it out like a bed. The gap part from the slants should be down on the floor when the bed is out. Also, be careful when putting them in the fabric. So many reviews had ripped seams and torn foam and I think it was from being too rough. Take your time putting them in and gently putting the fabric where it needs to go and you’ll save yourself a lot of frustration. The fabric does have a counting sheep pattern that was hard to see in the description pics, but they’re really cute and not distracting. When fully put together, they were sturdy (for a foam couch) and comfy. The price was right for these compared to other brands. Are these gonna last 10 years? No. But for less than $50, you can have a comfy nap-place/book-reading couch (let’s be honest, tablet-watching spot!) for 2-3years that you won’t feel bad about tossing when it’s time.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 5, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great lounger for little people.
reviews.reviewText: We purchased this for a 2-year-old, and he's very fond of it. You have to pay careful attention to the way the foam is inserted into the cover, and it's not intuitive or well marked. the foam can be removed for cleaning, and the cover is machine washable. Once you have a grasp of the way the inserts are aligned, it's not hard to put it back together correctly. There is no support other than the rigidity of the foam inserts, so anyone over about 50 pounds is going to crush it and it will be like sitting in a bean bag chair.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 27, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars So soft & comfy!
reviews.reviewText: My toddler loves this. So cute and comfy. Perfect size for toddler- was a little tricky to put together.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 5, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Works for kids
reviews.reviewText: My boys love this couch. Set up was not hard, but did take a little while because I was trying to be careful not to rip the fabric. The foam expanded within 5 minutes of being out of the wrapping. It was a little tricky to get the arm pieces to fit. It almost seems like both sides of fabric were an inch too short. I got it to fit though. Of course, it being foam, it won't hold its shape very well. One side is already very droopy after just 2 days. But, the kids love sitting on it, and actually prefer it folded out so they can also lay on it. I would buy this again.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 26, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Had a Minnie Mouse one and it ripped after a few months. The material was very thin. This one has a thick cover and is a little wider than the other character ones. My toddlers can share it but I wouldn’t say bigger kids would be able to sit together comfortably. The material is soft though and I like it better than the other brand. It’s still the flimsy foam underneath but works for what it is.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 29, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars very flimsy but he likes it
reviews.reviewText: The couch looks kind of cheap. The arms are the problem. They are very thin and if he leans against them he falls over. We have Tile plank flooring and he has fallen over and hit his head so I wish it was more sturdy. Problem is he loves it. Every time he comes over to Grandma's house he runs to it and sits down . I have to admit it is very comfortable. I will probably donate it and try to find something more sturdy but have looked and not many choices.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 14, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Patience is needed but it’s nice
reviews.reviewText: Things I would rather do or go through if I could trade putting this together again:Pissed off wife in 2nd trimesterHemorrhoidsDMV appointmentTraffic jamFlat tireSo I let it sit out unpacked for 24 hours and still was a huge pain in the butt, video online is better than the instructions just barely. Guy is putting it together smoothly while pretty much having a glass of wine, that is not the reality he probably did it over 10 times. Don’t smoke weed or have alcohol in you, have an hour without baby and enough sleep so you can do this right, smoke weed and drink afterwards. I wouldn’t buy it again unless it came assembled sorry nice but not worth the headache to me and having a newborn and wife is already stressful enough.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 4, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Love this but don’t wash the cover.
reviews.reviewText: Once cover was washed per following instructions, the couch was never the same again. Tight fit for the sleeve and just awkward after that. But it’s still comfy and fun. I like
Bought for our grandaughter. She loved it right from the start. Comfortable, soft and we can’t help but just watch her while she lounges away watching her fav movie!!! Just so precious.
My 1 year old loves to lay on it and feels like he is one of the big kids. Not too big and perfect for little ones
Esta súper lindo y cómodo, se tiene que poner bien el forro para que se vea bonito pero no es difícil, a mi me encanto es para mi bebe de un año

reviews.reviewerName: Itzel Alondra Lopez lopezItzel Alondra Lopez lopez
reviews.reviewText: A mi hijo le encanto es cómodo y lo puedo acomodar donde quepa !Solo si hay que ver bien el manual para acomodarlo bien y quede Perfecto 👌🏻Cumple su función 🙌🏻
It's super comfy my kids love it but it's so hard to take apart to clean.
